thread.title: Man sought in Bayou St. John home invasion, sex assault
thread.title_full: Man sought in Bayou St. John home invasion, sex assault - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Kelly Weston, Digital Content Producer
title: Man sought in Bayou St. John home invasion, sex assault
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - The NOPD is asking for the public’s help in identifying and locating an unknown male who robbed and sexually assaulted a 28-year old woman in the Bayou St. John neighborhood.
The incident occurred Sept. 23 in the 800 block of North Lopez Street. Around 7 a.m., the suspect entered the victim’s home armed with a gun and demanded her property. The victim complied. The suspect then sexually assaulted the woman and fled on foot.
The suspect is described as a black male in his early 20s or 30s, 6’0” tall and about 185 pounds with a slim build and a dark complexion. He was last seen wearing a baseball cap, sunglasses, light-colored jacket, grey shorts and tennis shoes.
The suspect was captured on video surveillance at a local ATM as he tried to use the victim’s stolen credit card.
Special Victims Detective Herman Franklin is in charge of the investigation and can be reached at 504-658-5523.
Citizens with information that can help solve this crime are asked to call Crimestoppers at 822-1111 or toll-free 1-877-903-STOP. You could receive a cash reward of up to $2,500 for the information leading only to the arrest, except on homicides, where Crimestoppers will pay half of the reward upon the arrest and half on the indictment of the responsible person(s). You do not have to give your name nor testify to receive the reward but you must contact Crimestoppers directly with your information. Citizens can also submit an anonymous tip online to Crimestoppers at www.crimestoppersgno.org.
